intro: Fagraea galilai, commonly known as the Galilee flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces woody, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in rocky or dry environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and parks.
